title: AL champs' only question mark is closer role
subtitle: If flame-throwing rookie Rondon falters, Leyland has other 'pen options
body: The Tigers' present popularity and positivity was probably best illustrated by the healthy scalping market that took place outside TigerFest at Comerica Park over the weekend. Even mere discussion about the club's upcoming 2013 season makes for a tantalizing ticket. Thing is, there's not a whole heck of a lot to discuss -â€“ at least, not in the realm of roster debate that so often flows from the lips of fans this time of year. The Tigers, fresh off an American League title and hopeful of another World Series opportunity, have about as firm an Opening Day outlook as a club -- particularly a contending club -- can hope for two weeks before Spring Training camp. Anthony Castrovince is a reporter for MLB.com. Read his columns and follow him on Twitter at @Castrovince. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Anthony Castrovince
